result.execSummary:
All charges against Jayne Clara Meyer in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jayne Clara Meyer is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayne Clara Meyer

records.addlTxt: Clerk moved $500 bond money off 22CF420 to case 21CF903. bph
Filed by Atty Dobbe. arc

8:01 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Jayne Clara Meyer in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Jayne Clara Meyer.  Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF903, 22CF113, 22CF386, & 22CF420. Court quashes any authorized warrants.  ADA Ellenwood recites joint agreement and states DE has completed 20 days jail only asking to acknowledge jail time, not asking for more time, Court notes jail credit. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 21CF903 and G to Ct 1- Bail Jumping- Felony in 22CF386. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 21CF903 & 22CF386.  On motion of the State without objection, Crt read in and dismisses Ct 3 in 22CF386 for restitution purposes, Court out right dismisses Ct 2 & 3 in 21CF903, Ct 2 in 22CF386, 22CF113, & 22CF420 ($500 bond on file). Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 21CF903
S/W 2 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
 Apply Bond from 22CF420. Balance to be pd through probation

Court Orders: Ct 1 in 22CF386
S/W 2 Years Probation

- Court Costs: $268     
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
- Restitution: $708
 Apply Bond from 22CF420. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- Absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow through 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- No Contact with J. Paulson
- Pay Supervision fees
- Sign up for probation today, 9/30/22

filed by DE requesting to appear by zoom for today's hearing or reschedule. Includes 21CF903, 22CF113, 22CF386, 22CF420. Per SRN on 9/28/22- Denied. JA left a voicemail with the number listed on DE's letter. bph

Clerk advised on faxing a request asking to appear by zoom or to reschedule hearing, either would need to be approved by the Judge.  DE plans to fax a request over right away and will call to confirm it was received.  DE states she did leave a message for Atty but hasn't heard back at this time. bph

2:11 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for the State of Wisconsin accompanied by Tina Sitz from JSC.  Defendant Jayne Clara Meyer in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Jayne Clara Meyer. Includes 21CF903(PLEAS), 22CF113 (PLEAS), 22CF386 (PTC), & 22CF420 (PH).  Court reviews files.  Atty Dobbe would like to proceed with prelim on 22CF420.  S/T of Tina Sitz.  Direct by ADA Ellenwood.  Atty Dobbe asking the Court to take Judicial Notice of bond in 22CF386.  Court takes Judicial Notice. Cross by Atty Dobbe. Redirect by ADA Ellenwood.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  ADA Ellenwood states 22CF386 still needs a PH.  ADA Ellenwood states DE tested at JSC prior to hearing today came back as abnormal, requesting DE to have mouth swab before leaving today.  Atty Dobbe states DE is willing to waive PH on 22CF386, Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Court will schedule both 22CF386 & 22CF420 files for ARGN, and STC on the other cases. Court orders DE to give JSC an oral swab.  Bond continues, DE confirms address and phone number.  Adjourned at 2:26 PM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22R 009790.  $500.00 Paid by Aaron H. cah
Receipt # 22R 009717
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to have baseline test today (7/14/22).

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.
Faxed: Dispatch, Jail, & SCSO. bph

1:24 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: K. Edwards, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA: Michelle Brekkn with Student Intern Alison Casey DF ATTY: Stephanie Schmidt for today  Defendant Jayne Clara Meyer in court, in custody. QUASH WARRANT. Defendant qualifies for PD.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; JSC states DE hasn't tested since 3/1/22. Atty Schmidt states DE waived extradition from MN, where she was picked up on this warrant. Bond ordered. Speedy prelim requested. Court will have JA schedule prelim with Atty Dobbe.
